entries.femaleVariant: Hey, you! What'd you have for dinner? Some scop-paste from a tube? Meat-spray? Yellow tap water and canned high-fructose syrup?
What do you think they give to people living in the corp villages? I'll tell you – rare steaks and lobsters on silver platters, wine bottled from a time without constant acid rain.
You'll say it's always been this way. The rich and the poor, the miserable and the contented.
At least back in the good ol' days everyone was equal in the face of death. The Fates snipped your thread and Charon took you across the river Styx for a single obol.

My, my, how things have changed. The rich have boosted their lifespans by years, decades, even centuries! They've swapped their organs for implants, cured cancer with nanites, exchanged their wrinkles and flabs for syn-skin!
But oh no, they won't stop there! Arasaka's made a new biochip – Relic, storing a real human being's consciousness, their memory, knowledge, everything but their flesh and blood.
But what's a body nowadays if not a dry, disgusting coccoon from which our real selves—enhanced modified, immortal—are supposed to emerge?

It's the end of death – that's what the Relic is! The top one percent of the one percent are using it to build their own paradise on Earth – except instead of St. Peter, there's a terminal showin' the price of your soul!
And what about the rest of us gray, ordinary Night Citizens? While they're living in their pristine, glass skyscrapers on New Olympus, we'll be eating shit off the streets!
This is it – our final stop before we sleepwalk over the cliff.
Wake up, people – it's the millionaires of this world that need a good shove.
